Name: Requiring each community board to establish a veterans committee
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring each community board to establish a veterans committee

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - March 19, 2024

Summary: This bill would require each community board to establish a committee dedicated to the needs of veterans and their families within the community district, and would require such committee meetings to be open to the public (except as otherwise provided by law).
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision d of section 2800 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new subparagraph 23 to read as follows:
      (23) Establish a committee dedicated to the needs of veterans and their families, with the meetings of such committee open to the public except as otherwise provided by law.
      ï¿½2.  This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
